## **Description**
The **Document Info **operator allows to return information on the current document, based on the configuration settings.

## **Input**
**Input**

**Data type**

**Description**

**in0**

Any

Input node that triggers the execution of the operator

> **Example**

To return the progressive number of the document being processed, link **in0 **to the DOCUMENT node of the input file.

By doing so, every time that the reader encounters the &lt;DOCUMENT&gt; tag, it triggers the operator, which then returns the progressive number of the current document as output.

## **Output**
**Output**

**Data type**

**Description**

**out0**

Any

Information on the current document, based on the configuration settings

## **Settings**
**![](data:image/png;base64,)**

- From the **Reader **drop-down menu, select the Reader component for which you want to return more information.

- From the **Variable **drop-down menu, select the type of numeric value of the document in the input data stream. The available options are:

**Progressive**: progressive number of the document in the input data stream

- **Document start line number**: number of the document's starting line in the input data stream

- Click **Apply **to confirm.

## **Special cases**
None.
